intro: Physalis hintonii, commonly known as the Hinton's groundcherry, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green fruits enclosed in a papery, inflated calyx that turns orange-red as the fruit matures. Its flowers are typically white or pale purple, and it thrives in arid to semi-arid environments. Physalis hintonii is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
